item.title: Taj Gibson denies report he was told to prepare to be a starter next seaso

item.description: The Bulls were 5-1 when he started for Carlos Boozer last season... time to amnesty Boozer? Finally?

item.title: If the Clippers are finally up for sale, who might buy them? Oprah, Yao Ming, Grant Hill just a few names to watch.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Helin
item.description: Grant Hill and Yao Ming are putting together groups, but bet against Oprah Winfrey, David Geffen and Larry Ellison at your own risk.

item.title: Pacers’ Paul George cleared by doctors, expected to play in Game 3
item.dc:creator: Kurt Helin
item.description: The Pacers needed him and his shot creation if they were going to steal a game in Miami. Or two.

item.title: Paul George on saying he blacked out during Game 2: ‘I probably should have kept that to myself’
item.dc:creator: Brett Pollakoff
item.description: The only motivation for Paul George to withhold information would be to avoid the concussion diagnosis, which requires a series of league-mandated tests to be passed before he can be cleared to play.

item.title: Report: NBA won’t approve Shelly Sterling as controlling owner of the Clippers
item.dc:creator: Brett Pollakoff
item.description: In order for Shelly Sterling to oversee a forced sale of the Clippers, the league would have to approve her as a controlling owner. And that's not happening.

item.title: Gregg Popovich’s reaction to Serge Ibaka potentially returning for Game 3: ‘Shocked. I’m so surprised.’
item.dc:creator: Brett Pollakoff
item.description: And by "so surprised" he means exactly the opposite.

item.title: NBA says it will continue process to terminate ownership interests in Clippers in response to latest Sterling reports
item.dc:creator: Brett Pollakoff
item.description: Reports that Donald Sterling has agreed to allow his wife Shelly to negotiate a forced sale of the Clippers won't deter the NBA in continuing its process to terminate his ownership.
